DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Clinical Trial Use Sequence Enrollment Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator for determining if sequencing results are used to enroll a patient on a therapeutic clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Clinical Trial Use Sequence Analysis Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A clinical study that involves administering of exposure to the agent/agents to subjects with particular disease to elucidate the most appropriate treatment for a specific medical condition, or to prolong or improve the patient's life._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._The determination of the sequence of component residues in a macromolecule, e.g. amino acids in a protein or nucleotide bases in DNA/RNA or the computational analysis performed to determine the similarities between nonidentical proteins or molecules of DNA or RNA._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Therapeutic Clinical Trial Use Sequence Analysis Enrollment
Property.preferredDefinition: A clinical study that involves administering of exposure to the agent/agents to subjects with particular disease to elucidate the most appropriate treatment for a specific medical condition, or to prolong or improve the patient's life._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._The determination of the sequence of component residues in a macromolecule, e.g. amino acids in a protein or nucleotide bases in DNA/RNA or the computational analysis performed to determine the similarities between nonidentical proteins or molecules of DNA or RNA._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A clinical study that involves administering of exposure to the agent/agents to subjects with particular disease to elucidate the most appropriate treatment for a specific medical condition, or to prolong or improve the patient's life.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

The determination of the sequence of component residues in a macromolecule, e.g. amino acids in a protein or nucleotide bases in DNA/RNA or the computational analysis performed to determine the similarities between nonidentical proteins or molecules of DNA or RNA.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, on a non-COG clinical trial
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes, on a non-COG clinical trial

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes, on a non-COG clinical trial
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

An NCI-supported clinical cooperative group formed by the merger of the four national pediatric cancer research organizations: the Children's Cancer Group, the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study Group, the National Wilms Tumor Study Group, and the Pediatric Oncology Group. The primary objective of the organization is to conduct clinical trials of new therapies for childhood and adolescent cancer. COG develops and coordinates clinical trials conducted at the 238 member institutions that include cancer centers of all major universities and teaching hospitals throughout the U.S. and Canada, as well as sites in Europe and Australia. COG members include over 5000 cancer researchers.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The affirmative response to a question.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
